criteria: Integration of New Arguments or Information
descriptions: The student does not use technology to produce, publish, or update writing.
The student attempts to use technology for writing but struggles significantly.
The student uses technology to produce writing, but struggles to publish or update it based on feedback.
The student uses technology to produce and publish writing, but updates are minimal or not responsive to feedback.
The student effectively uses technology to produce and publish writing, incorporating some feedback into updates.
The student skillfully uses technology to produce, publish, and update writing, thoroughly incorporating feedback and new information to refine arguments.
The student does not incorporate feedback into their writing.
The student attempts to incorporate feedback but misunderstands or misapplies it.
The student acknowledges feedback but struggles to implement it effectively in their writing.
The student incorporates some feedback into their writing, but inconsistencies or gaps remain.
The student demonstrates a good understanding of feedback and incorporates it thoughtfully into their writing.
The student expertly integrates feedback, showing a deep understanding of its implications and using it to significantly improve the quality and persuasiveness of their arguments.
The student does not include new arguments or information in their writing.
The student includes new arguments or information, but they are irrelevant or poorly integrated.
The student attempts to integrate new arguments or information, but they disrupt the flow or coherence of the writing.
The student includes new arguments or information, but they are not fully developed or connected to the main points.
The student effectively integrates new arguments or information, enhancing the depth and complexity of their writing.
The student seamlessly integrates new arguments or information, strengthening their claims and demonstrating a comprehensive understanding of the topic.
